item.title: The Right to Counsel for Tenants
item.description: Landlords are removing New Jerseyans from their homes at the highest rate since the pandemic began. In response, the North New Jersey Chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America (NNJDSA) is organizing a campaign to pass a ‚ÄúRight to Counsel‚Äù (RTC) ordinance in Jersey City. RTC refers to government policy that funds free legal representation for people at risk of losing their homes. Sometimes that risk is due to eviction filing, a landlord‚Äôs failure to make necessary repairs, harassment or discrimination by a landlord, or any circumstance that may put tenants at risk of being forced to move.

item.title: Right to Counsel FAQs
item.description: What is the right to counsel? The right to counsel is a legal guarantee that a tenant will be granted representation by an attorney before they are evicted from their home. How effective is the right to counsel at preventing evictions? Studies of the jurisdictions that have passed right to counsel laws all reveal benefits to tenants. When represented through RTC programs, tenants are much more likely to stay in their homes ‚Äî as much as 41% ‚Äî because lawyers can help tenants identify available defenses and resources like rental assistance programs.

item.title: About Right to Counsel
item.description: Nationwide, only 3% of tenants are represented in housing court, while for landlords that‚Äôs more like 81% on average. Let’s join 15 cities and 3 states and pass right to counsel. To fight back against all eviction and displacement we need to guarantee the right to counsel for ALL tenants.
